meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Let's get down to business – Lords of the Fallen, a Soulslike RPG that's all about swapping between two versions of the world to solve puzzles and slay enemies. Sounds cool, right? And yeah, it is! But, as we'll find out, not without some major hiccups.

First off, let me say that I'm not just another critic trying to make a name for myself in the gaming community (although, let's be real, who doesn't love a good bit of self-promotion?). No, no – I'm here to give you the lowdown on Lords of the Fallen. And trust me, after reading through all these reviews (yes, all 8 of them!), I've got some juicy insights to share.

Now, where did we start? Ah yes, IGN's review! "A great soulslike" they called it. And indeed, it is – that concept I mentioned earlier? It's genius! Swapping between the two worlds adds a whole new layer of depth to the game. But, as they said, there are some major technical issues holding it back.

Slant Magazine agrees on that front, calling it "a fresh spin on the Soulsborne formula." Yeah, it's definitely different from your average Soulslike RPG. But what about those pesky bugs?

Gaming Age gets a bit more optimistic, saying that while Lords of the Fallen has some kinks to work out, they're hopeful for its future. And honestly, I think they're onto something there – the devs do seem pretty receptive to feedback.

Worth Playing takes it a step further, calling Lords of the Fallen "far ahead of the pack" in terms of Soulslike games. They even give it props for innovating and looking good while doing so!

Now, things take a bit of a turn with SpazioGames, who calls the game "very far from top-notch soulslike games." Ouch! Yeah, maybe not the most glowing review... But hey, someone's gotta be the bearer of bad news, right?

GamingTrend is a bit more balanced in their assessment – while acknowledging some issues, they still think it's an entertaining game with great action RPG elements.

Finally, we've got God is a Geek saying that while Lords of the Fallen is enjoyable and challenging, it sometimes lacks focus. Yeah, I can see that – maybe just needs a bit of tweaking to really hit its stride.

So, there you have it – 8 different takes on Lords of the Fallen! What do you think? Ready to dive in and explore this game for yourself?
